result.execSummary:
The defendant Volker P Rothgerber was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Defendant shall have no direct or indirect contact with HLM, DOB: 4-10-78, or her residence.  

Defendant shall not be within 500 feet of HLM, DOB: 4-10-78, or her residence.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent, including AODA assessment/treatment.

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.

Defendant shall submit to random drug screens of his blood, breath or urine.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Volker P Rothgerber

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Documents verified with scanning; Paper file destroyed, retained electronically (scanned).

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Def appeared in person.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson for State.  Resolution reached.  Court has colloquy with Defendant regarding his right to counsel and accepts continued waiver.  Guilty plea entered.  Court finds def guilty.  Statement by victim's sister.  Statement by Atty. Hanson and Defendant.  Court proceeds to sentencing.
Victim does not request to be present for hearings
Absolute sobriety; No contact with HLM or her residence

Def appears in person in custody.  Atty Mark D. Bensen for State.  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  $500 signature bond set.  Def waives right to attorney.  Adjourned for pretrial with DA.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 2, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
